country_overview.content: South Korea, known for its vibrant culture, technological advancements, and rich history, is a popular destination for tourists and business travelers alike. From bustling cities like Seoul to historical sites and picturesque landscapes, South Korea offers a diverse range of experiences. The country's visa policies are managed by the Korean Immigration Service, which facilitates various types of visas for different purposes, including tourism, work, and study.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa (C-3)
tourist_visa.description: The Tourist Visa (C-3) allows visitors to stay in South Korea for up to 90 days for tourism purposes. It is suitable for those traveling for leisure or visiting friends and family.

student_visa.title: Student Visa (D-2)
student_visa.description: The Student Visa (D-2) is for individuals who have been accepted into an accredited South Korean educational institution. The visa is valid for the duration of the course and provides the opportunity to study full-time.

work_visa.title: Work Visa (E-2)
work_visa.description: The Work Visa (E-2) is for foreign nationals seeking employment in South Korea, particularly in teaching English. It allows individuals to work for a specified employer and is typically valid for up to 1 year.

business_visa.title: Business Visa (D-8)
business_visa.description: The Business Visa (D-8) is for individuals engaging in business activities or investment in South Korea. It is valid for up to 3 years, depending on the nature of the business and agreement with the Korean authorities.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must demonstrate that they are visiting South Korea for tourism, have a valid passport, and sufficient funds for their stay. They must also meet health and character requirements.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Proof of accommodation (hotel booking or invitation letter)
additional_documents: Letter of invitation from a friend or family member (if applicable)
Proof of employment or studies in the home country

student_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must be accepted into an accredited South Korean educational institution and demonstrate their ability to financially support themselves during their studies. Health and character requirements must also be met.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Certificate of Admission from a South Korean educational institution

work_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have a job offer from a South Korean employer and meet specific qualifications and experience requirements. Health and character requirements must be satisfied.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Job offer letter or employment contract
Proof of relevant qualifications and experience
additional_documents: Proof of any previous visits to South Korea

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the appropriate visa type based on your purpose of visit to South Korea. Ensure you meet the eligibility requirements for the selected visa category.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Review the specific eligibility requirements for the visa type you are applying for, including health and character requirements.

step_3.title: Gather Required Documents
step_3.description: Collect all necessary documents including the visa application form, passport, photographs, and supporting documents relevant to your visa type.

step_4.title: Complete the Application Form
step_4.description: Fill out the visa application form accurately. Applications can be submitted online or through South Korean embassies and consulates.

step_5.title: Submit the Application
step_5.description: Submit your completed application form along with the required documents. Ensure that all documents are provided as per the requirements for your visa type.

step_6.title: Wait for Processing
step_6.description: Processing times for South Korean visas vary based on the type of visa and individual circumstances. Check current processing times on the Korean Immigration Service website.

step_7.title: Receive the Visa
step_7.description: Once your visa is approved, you will be notified. Ensure that all details on the visa are correct before traveling.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees for South Korean visas vary depending on the type of visa and duration of stay. Fees are payable at the time of application and are non-refundable.

processing_time.content: Processing times for South Korean visas vary. Tourist and business visas typically take a few weeks, while student and work visas may take longer. Check current processing times on the Korean Immigration Service website.

visa_validity.content: The validity of South Korean visas depends on the type of visa issued. Tourist visas are generally valid for up to 90 days, while work and student visas may be valid for up to 3 years.

entry_requirements.content: Upon arrival in South Korea, travelers must present their valid visa, passport, and may be required to provide additional documentation such as proof of accommodation and sufficient funds.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my visa while in South Korea?
faq_1.answer: Extensions for South Korean visas may be possible under certain circumstances. You should contact local immigration authorities for detailed information on the extension process.

faq_2.question: Is a visa required before arrival in South Korea?
faq_2.answer: Yes, most travelers need to obtain a visa before arriving in South Korea. You can apply for a visa online or through a South Korean embassy or consulate.

faq_3.question: Can I work in South Korea on a Tourist Visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a Tourist Visa is not permitted. If you wish to work in South Korea, you must apply for a Work Visa.
